articles.description: The Football Association charges Newcastle United midfielder Sandro Tonali with misconduct in relation to alleged breaches of the governing body's betting rules.
articles.title: FA charges Tonali over alleged betting rules breaches

articles.description: Tatyana Heard and Megan Jones will form a new centre partnership for England in their Women's Six Nations game against Wales at Ashton Gate on Saturday.
articles.title: England make seven changes for Wales game

articles.description: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers is given a one-match touchline ban with another suspended, which means he will not miss the forthcoming Old Firm derby.
articles.title: Celtic's Rodgers gets one-game ban but free for derby

articles.description: The Enhanced Games has been derided as "a clown show" and "borderline criminal". But their founder and his backers believe in a future few have foreseen.
articles.title: The mind behind the 'doped Olympics'

articles.description: Former Wales rugby star Louis Rees-Zammit is talking with Super Bowl champions the Kansas City Chiefs as he tries to find an NFL team willing to sign him for next season.
articles.title: Louis Rees-Zammit: What would signing for NFL team mean? Where could he go?

articles.description: The Golden State Warriors overcome Draymond Green's early ejection to claim a 101-93 win against the Orlando Magic.
articles.title: NBA: Golden State Warriors overcome early Draymond Green ejection to beat Orlando Magic

articles.description: Chelsea manager Mauricio Pochettino says it is important the club's fans and players 'move on' after Raheem Sterling was booed by supporters.
articles.title: Sterling 'understands' Chelsea boos - Pochettino

articles.description: Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner moves into the Miami semi-finals by ending Czech opponent Tomas Machac's stunning run.
articles.title: Miami Open: Jannik Sinner beats Tomas Machac to reach semi-finals

articles.description: England manager Gareth Southgate will name an expanded initial Euro 2024 squad on 21 May, with Uefa to consider views on bigger squads.
articles.title: Southgate to name expanded England Euros squad

articles.description: British elite sportswomen tell BBC Sport about their experiences of disordered eating and ask what an athlete is 'supposed' to look like.
articles.title: 'Guilty' and 'obsessive' - sportswomen on disordered eating
